Computers can be analogue, digital, or hybrid. Digital computers, the most common type, are devices that do all of the following: store the processing program or programs and the data immediately necessary for the execution of a program, can be freely programmed in accordance with the requirements of the user, perform arithmetical computations specified by the user and execute, without human intervention, a processing program that requires the computer to modify its execution by logical decision during the processing run.
